doc.after: Bateman's work on cricket and the British Empire identifies Ranjitsinhji as an important figure in helping build "imperial cohesion", adding that his "cultural impact was immense".[230] Bateman identifies in particular the use of Ranji's image during his era in advertising in England and Australia.[230] This was a marked turnaround from the racism Ranji had faced early in his career, which he had tried to overcome with techniques, such as adopting the pseudonym, "Smith".[78]
